meanings.definition: Make a sharp sibilant sound as of the letter s.
meanings.sent1: The snake hissed loudly when it felt threatened.
meanings.sent2: She hissed at her misbehaving cat to stop scratching the furniture.
meanings.sent3: The kettle hissed like an angry cat demanding attention.
meanings.sent4: The wind hissed through the trees, creating an eerie atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The steam hissed from the pressure cooker, signaling it was ready.

meanings.definition: Say something in a sibilant, high-pitched voice.
meanings.sent1: The witch hissed a spell as she stirred her cauldron.
meanings.sent2: The angry teacher hissed a warning to the noisy students.
meanings.sent3: The villain hissed his evil plan to his henchmen in a dark alley.
meanings.sent4: The wind hissed through the cracks in the old house, creating a spooky effect.
meanings.sent5: The steam hissed from the teapot, announcing that tea was ready.
